pageContext.patina: Dark green patina dull golden bronze metal showing through.
pageContext.publications: 1898 Catalogue ie. Shrops. Arch. Trans. X (2nd S.) p. 106, (It was No. J8 in the Exhibition of Shrops Antiqs. described as "found about 400 yards from the old Stone Circle of Mitchell's Fold.",Anden's LIst V.C.H. Shrops I, p. 203
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1923,George Mountford Esq.,The School, Churchstoke,Montgomeryshire
pageContext.site: England, shropshire,chirbury,middleton-in-chirbury,found by the owners' father about 1880, when digging a drain about 18 inches deep in one of the field which he occupiied at mitchell's fold tenement
pageContext.remarks: It is kept in the School Museum with a stone Celt from the district and a number of spindle whorls from various localities.
